answers.answer: I did with #2.  It started as heartburn sensation  and over a months time it worsen.  My first attack felt like labor pains and vomiting followed.  Went to hospital and was checked by labor and delivery they sent me to ER.  While there they figured it was my gallbladder and had an ultrasound.  Found there were stones that were trying to pass.  They gave me a list of food I could eat and the food was all fat free.  Three days later back in ER because the broth I drank (& on the approved food list) made me sick again.  The lining had thickened and was referred to a surgery specialist.  By the end of the week surgery was done while 20 weeks prego.  Just don't fall behind on the pain med the first night.  Also any liver surgery (because this is metabolic system) can throw off your blood sugar.  I failed my gestation diabetes test took the three hour and passed.  I tried to explain this to my doctor but he wouldn't have it.  So I went to a different office and retested past the one hour with flying colors.  Which lead me to believe they either didn't measure the drink correct or the surgery messed with my numbers.Granted this is is the rated G version.

question: Anyone have gallbladder problems while pregnant? Curious about your story/situation.
title: gallbladder
